column1: Haldaur is a city and a municipal board in Bijnor district in the Indian state of Uttar Pradesh.

Haldaur is located at 29.3°N 78.28°E﻿ / 29.3; 78.28. It has an average elevation of 220 metres (721 feet). Haldaur is close to the district headquarters and well connected by the bus system as well as trains.Musorie express
column2: garhwal expresse & Chandigarh lucknow express are some trains which passes through the Haldaur Railway station.

column1: The town has two degree colleges
column2: R.P.S. degree college and Gahlaut Degree College
column3: Two famous Intermediate colleges C.D.Inter college & R.H.S.inter college and  few public schools St. Marry

column1: The town is located on the famous Panipat khatima State highway. the capital of India
column2: New Delhi is just about 175 kilometers far from the town.

column1: It was founded by Raja Haldar Singh during 18th century.

column3: 567. Males constitute 53% of the population and females 47%. Haldaur has an average literacy rate of 71%
column4: higher than the national average of 59.5%: male literacy is 78%
column5: and female literacy is 64%. In Haldaur
column6: 15% of the population is under 6 years of age.
